poem:
Switching Off  

The meters, silent  
as a dozing sunbeam,  
wait for the pulse—  
a signal gone astray.  
  
Lorraine Kelly smiles,  
yet beneath the smile,  
a chill breath whispers  
through summer's warmth.  
  
Radiators croon,  
unexpected heat—  
the tango of tech,  
when it forgets  
its own steps.  
  
In the hum of  
electronic lullabies,  
homes hold their breath.
